context: The Finnish word 'paras' is the superlative form of the adjective hyvä (good). It means 'the best' and is used to indicate something or someone that is superior to all others in quality. In different contexts, it can also translate to 'most excellent,' 'superb,' or 'outstanding.' The word remains unchanged regardless of grammatical number but changes with case - for example, paras (nominative), parasta (partitive), parhaan (genitive).
